benchmark_details.name: ProjectEval
benchmark_details.overview: ProjectEval is a new benchmark for LLM agents project-level code generation's automated evaluation by simulating user interaction. It features automated evaluation tests, diverse input levels, and aims to enhance explainability and usability from a user perspective.
benchmark_details.data_type: test cases for code generation projects

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the programming ability of LLM agents in generating project-level code through user interaction simulation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Some projects may not align with Django design patterns; currently only supports Python.

data.source: Constructed using LLM with human reviewing and editing.
data.size: 20 tasks with a total of 284 test cases
data.annotation: Manual and semi-automated with revisions from human reviewers.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on pass rates and similarity evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better capability of LLM agents in generating functional code.
methodology.baseline_results: Results from existing benchmarks like DevBench for comparative analysis.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validated against existing benchmarks to ensure reliability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential introduction of harmful code during automated evaluations.
